brief_summary.textblock:
This study measures residential exposures (indoor allergens, mold, nitrogen dioxide,
      nicotine) and relates exposure levels to daily symptoms (wheeze, persistent cough, chest
      tightness, shortness of breath) and medication use,  in a population of children with
      physician diagnosed asthma, followed for 12 months.

clinical_study.brief_title: Asthma Severity in Children and Environmental Agents

criteria.textblock:
-  Siblings of a birth cohort recruited 1997-1999

          -  Age less than 11 years

          -  Physician diagnosed asthma

          -  Active symptoms (wheeze, persistent cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath) or
             medication use in the 12 months prior to enrollment.

facility.name: Yale Center for Perinatal, Pediatric & Environmental Epidemiology

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences (NIEHS)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Defined Population, Time Perspective: Longitudinal
